website_summaries.verdict: Despite the low price this is a sturdy option that is easy to transport.
pros: Assembling this practice basket is easy, and the result is a surprisingly sturdy basket for the price
The unusual chain design catches discs well, and the basket can be quickly dismantled
cons: A few customers have noted that the chains can come apart after some use

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Well made, and unlike a previous reviewer's experience, The release pins matched up perfectly. It assembles and takes apart quickly. I do think the flag will eventually break, so I will keep my eyes out for replacement sticks. The flag is useful for determining wind strength and direction. It definitely does not catch discs as well as a standard basket, but since this is most likely going to be used for fun and practice I don't see that being much of an issue. You know when it would have stayed in the basket anyway, and you still get a nice "ching" when you hit the chains.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce D

customer_reviews.title: A gem of a basket
customer_reviews.text: This basket is a great product and well worth the price. Does it catch discs? Yup! Feels like I'm out on the course. Other reviews mentioned this lacking in chains but I've not noticed any issues with discs sticking to the basket. Is this really portable? It sure is, takes 5 minutes (1-2 after you get the hang of it) to assemble/disassemble. Push pins and screws with knobs are all it takes. The only issue here is there is no bag/carrying case (more expensive models have this). Does this feel durable? Durable enough! If the push pins fail I imagine i will have to work the tension screw knobs into overtime, but really it's a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Plenty sturdy for home practice
customer_reviews.text: relatively well built. Lighter duty than ones at public courses, but plenty sturdy for home practice. Size and height seem correct. Not sure how long the spring clips in the posts will last when exposed to the elements but you can easily use a bolt or pin to replace the clips once they fail. The flags are on a plastic stick, and may not take too may blows from a stray shot. For the price there is nothing else close to these that I have seen.
customer_reviews.author: SJ Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Unique chain design sets this apart from other baskets at this price.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this basket for a couple days but am very impressed so far. It is rather lightweight (in case you need to move it around) and is still rather sturdy. The best part (for me) is the design of the chains. The chains are rather lightweight, however the netting design catches discs very well - eliminating the need for a second inner row of chains. While this design may not be PDGA approved it is been a great addition to my private course and functions at least as well as the Discraft Chainstart Lite 24 chain baskets that I have on the rest of the course at less than half the price.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Best basket under $100
customer_reviews.text: Assembled in 5 minutes. Didn't need instructions and untangling the chains was the most difficult part of putting together the basket. Set up and tossed a putter in and rang the chains. Best deal on a quality basket you can find anywhere. Fit and finish can't be beat for under a $100.
customer_reviews.author: D. Handley

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Priced.
customer_reviews.text: Got this on 7/3/19. Full metal made, came in 6 pieces plus some hardware. Easy to assemble, but I would have appreciated an additional bolt through the top 'hat'. Paint looks good, had at least one scuff on the top shroud. Unfortunately some rain started coming down, and our first session was cut short. Some of my close puts would go straight through the chains, I feel they should be slightly heavier chains, and I may buy some from a hardware store. All in all it was worth every penny. I would rate this a 4.5/5. I will indeed update this post if I have issues with this basket in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler K.

customer_reviews.title: Great basket for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great basket for the price. The crossweave pattern makes up for the lack of a second row of chains in preventing spit-out. The flagstick will break the first time you hit it with a disc but otherwise this is a sturdy product. I smashed the chains from about 5 feet away to see if it would tip and it stood like a rock.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Price/Cheap Basket
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful for this basket because it was such a low price and looks to be similar quality as some more expensive baskets... I was wrong. It is very cheaply made, the pieces fit very loose and the basket moves a lot when you putt into it. The locking pins get caught in the set screw holes and fall out. You have to spend 5 minutes trying to get them back in. The metal is very thin and bends easily. There were a few bends in the metal upon arrival. Overall, if you're serious about disc gold and plan to practice on this thing, I would steer clear.
customer_reviews.author: DiscGolfGuy

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing to dislike about this product they're closing the park Frisbee golf courses so this is perfect to set up in the yard
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Kevin Davis

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this. Super easy to set up and break down, easily transportable. This has definitely improved my short game.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Bean

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a grear basket at this price point. It looks much like other name brand baskets in this price point. However this is better made than all the other ones I have experienced. I own a discmania basket as well and this Yaheetech basket out performs it in the paint, bolt quality, and thicker metal gauge. I think it catches just as poorly as any basket in this price range, if you hit the pole hard it will not stick, but on the sides it catches surprisingly well and doesnt cut through.
customer_reviews.author: sherrie

customer_reviews.title: Concerns about longterm durability
customer_reviews.text: This disc golf basket is very easy to assemble following the instructions and sturdy when set up on level ground but there are several paint imperfections which worry me for long term durability. While it's easy to assemble it's not one that I'd consider portable as it requires an allen wrench for assembly and doesn't come with a bag or anything. Despite being fairly well packaged in the box there are a couple spots that seem to have been, very poorly, touched up at the factory and others are still showing bare metal, for this price I would've expected better.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: So happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This basket is better quality than I expected. Very sturdy and worth your money. The chains work well to catch your disc. I will say that the paint sheds easily during assembly, but not too much to make it a nuisance. Also, one of the 5 screw holes did not line up between the base and corresponding orange bar. This did not effect the performance of the basket. Very happy with this purchase and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a disc basket that doesn't break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Jewel

customer_reviews.title: Great backyard practice basket
customer_reviews.text: I needed a practice basket for my back yard that would be reasonably movable, able to be left outdoors, and sturdy/stable enough to withstand wind and the typical rigors of being hit with discs. This basket easily met my requirements. Unless you specifically need a top tier permanent public-course-grade basket, this one should be perfect for your needs. The price point is surprisingly low compared to the other practice baskets out there, but after several days and a few hours of throwing discs at it, I am completely satisfied with this basket. I was going to make my own practice basket until I found this one and, all things equal, this is a much better option.
customer_reviews.author: steventhehistorian

customer_reviews.title: Great Disc Golf Basket
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality disc golf basket. Great price. I already own a handful of high end disc golf baskets but didn't want to pay the high cost of another one. So I opted to try this basket and wasn't disappointed. It's worth getting if you're in the market for a nice basket, but don't want to pay a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good. A little heavy
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid. The chains weren't the easiest thing to attach (a little confusing) and mine appear to have two broken links on one side. Flag is yellow btw. I'm not too worried about my kids (4 and 8) knocking it over into themselves, but if they ever do, it will hurt them.
customer_reviews.author: Mew Mew

customer_reviews.title: Everything I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted a frolf cage in my backyard for years. I was a little worried this would feel cheap and be too light (e.g. it might blow over in the wind) given its price point, but it's excellent. It feels durable, and while it's light it's also very stable and just heavily enough weighted that it feels solid. Love that sound when the chains catch my disc!
customer_reviews.author: J. Wiltshire

customer_reviews.title: Well made, great in the backyard.
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Very durable, been using in the backyard and sometimes it lives in the trunk for new locations. The "pro" model with a bag dropped like a month after I picked this one up. Think would upgrade to that, if for nothing else than the travel bag. New to the game so I didnt want to drop a ton on a black hole or the like. Very happy with it. Beware when opening the box though, there was a ton of tiny styrofoam beads and pieces for shipping, had to vacuum the porch twice lol.
customer_reviews.author: Manick

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have 9 of these around my 11 acre yard. They all went together fine. They are lightweight enough to move with one hand for mowing. I don't stake them down, so they will blow over in a stiff wind, but I just stand them back up. They have been out in the weather all year. A few of the chains have gotten a bit rusty. One of the little balls off the top of the flag has gone missing. Otherwise they are still in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Computer Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Update: this basket is no good
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: this basket is NOT anti-rust. I have had 3 baskets now and they have all been disastrous, with poor quality metal just rusting and falling apart in no time. There are much better options out there. I tried to then contact the Seller after the latest basket broke, and they never responded no matter how many times I contacted. Eventually just gave up and asked Amazon for a refund and they did a claim to get my money back. Really poor, still have not heard from Yaheetech
customer_reviews.author: Alex Paynter

customer_reviews.title: Great basket
customer_reviews.text: Love this! There is a more expensive version (same brand) so I was worried this would be lesser quality but it’s not. I bought 2 as gifts,( this one and the more expensive one) The only difference is it doesn’t have a carrying case. Very sturdy! Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.author: tiffanie

customer_reviews.title: Great for casual practice
customer_reviews.text: Pro-tip: leave the packaging foam around the pole in the middle of the chains. Doesn't affect performance, just makes the chains quieter if you have close neighbors. Pros: Great for putting/general target practice Super easy to assemble/disassemble (under 5 min) Light and easy to transport, especially if you take it apart Inexpensive Cons: Not super sturdy (wouldn't hold up at a permanent course, but fine for casual practice) Chains don't seem to "catch" as well as normal baskets Basket seems shallow (but maybe this helps encourage precision?) Overall, I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definite buy
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with how sturdy this thing is I definitely recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Somers

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: I've bought three of these for a home course and they've worked out amazingly well, especially for the price. I had no issues putting it together nor moving them around the yard. They are sturdy enough to where I haven't had any tipping issues. The chain design catches discs just as well as regulation baskets I've played on at my local courses as well. I'll be buying a few more to finish up the course.
customer_reviews.author: Tim A.

customer_reviews.title: The best basket for your yard and maneuverability!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and very sturdy and well made. The box was damaged in shipping and retaped so I was missing a couple of small parts. I contacted customer service and they shipped the missing parts which I received in 3 days. The whole process- contacting them and receiving the replacement parts took 5 days. Excellent company and service! I highly recommend this company and their products.
customer_reviews.author: bekker

customer_reviews.title: Cannot beat the price!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, for this price (I paid total of 49 dollars I think with a random amazon-supplied coupon) you cannot find an easier putting practice basket. I assembled it in 5 minutes, took it outside, and was putting immediately, which was awesome! the basket is light, yet sturdy in the materials used...but sometimes I wish the poles fit more snugly in the sockets. I may add some padding inside the make it straighter/ more sturdy. the chains are perfect as they are; no need for more $ to get the 24 chains. All in all, I am very satisfied with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the Price!!!
customer_reviews.text: If your like me and really just looking for something to have around to practice your putting, then this is perfect. If your looking for something your seeing on the courses then this is not your product. I do love it because for the price and what other products out there that try to compare there is just no beating this. Well worth the money. I would give this 5 stars but for me it still could use improvement on the sturdiness when in the grass. Having said that, two simple stakes does the trick perfect!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth L.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price for anyone interested in putting around in your yard!
customer_reviews.text: Love the ALL metal stand, chains, basket etc. No plastic at all. Worth the price for sure!
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy basket
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my husband who loves to disc golf. I had previously spent $60 on a basket that was total junk so for only a bit more money, I was very pleased with how sturdy and well built this basket is. He uses it everyday and has even brought it down to our basement now that the weather is too cold to play outside. Had it a few months now and still looks brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Emma K

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, durable, would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat this for the price. I bought a different basket a couple years ago and this is very comparable. I like both. The chain weight on this one seems to be less than #2, but it does have cross chains to make up for that. It catches discs nicely and stays upright. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Cook

customer_reviews.title: Excellent disc golf basket for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've been disc golfing for a couple decades and have owned a couple of baskets, and for the price you can't beat it! It's a good, solid, weighty target. Was concerned that it only had 1 set of chains, but it totally grabs your disc and pulls it in perfectly! Already thinking about getting another one to set up a mini course in my backyard!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective pole and wobbly
customer_reviews.text: Very good for the price. Regulation size, very lightweight, and easy to disassemble (for the most part) The top rod isn't made properly and wouldn't fit into the basket or top. I tapped it with a hammer and it slid into place (lightly tap) but as expected it will not come out, so the top portion must remain intact when transporting. It's also a little wobbly but still great for the value
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: The chains
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot but the chain links in some places are attached wrong. I would definitely give one more star if the chains were not built wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Great for home course
customer_reviews.text: I bought a $120 cage at the same time I paid $65 for this one. The $120 was definitely heavier with a deeper cage but nothing I thought made the cost difference worth while. Discs hit and stay just as well. I ended buying 2 of theses cages. Was going to buy a 3rd but they just raised the price $10 less than a week later. Maybe supply and demand. Not happy about that. I did have trouble with the threads for the wing nuts as mentioned by a few other reviews. I personally don’t even see the need for the wing nuts. The locator pin design keeps this together well.
customer_reviews.author: sjqbec

customer_reviews.title: Good practice basket
customer_reviews.text: For the price these are fine. They’re great for practicing your putts or I use two in an open field with a friend so we can practice our different throws back and forth. Not up to par for a real corse. On long shots the chains don’t always grab it but it’s a helpful training thing to have and fun to play with around a camp site. Easily comes apart for transport
customer_reviews.author: Coxter

customer_reviews.title: Extremely great value. High quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This basket is an incredible value. I can’t believe it is in the $50 range. It is sturdy. It grabs disks well. It is heavy enough to be stable but light enough to move easy. I like the materials. The paint job is nice too. I’ve been Dolfing for 10 years. This is a great basket.
customer_reviews.author: 30 year old Millwright

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: This product works great and is very easy to assemble. My kids and I enjoy leaving it at the far end of out backyard and treated like a par 3 disc golf. Lots of fun for the family. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: PhiQuanTu

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Fun
customer_reviews.text: The chains are tricky to de-tangle and attach, but watching a video YouTube helped. I bought this for my husband's birthday and he loves It! The whole family has been enjoying it in our yard. Durable, sturdy, great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Kramer

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WELL!
customer_reviews.text: I have been playing disc golf since 2005. This is obviously not a Mach x or anything like that but it runs the correct dimensions and is so damn cheap that there is no excuse not to practice putting. Yes the chains are not that great but spend a few bucks at the local hardware store on thicker chains for the middle and it will be damn great. I order it in New York, during the Covid 19 for practice while in quarantine and it got there in 24 hours! I don't know how but it did. Amazing product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Wow! For roughly $55 each I was able to place 18 of these around my property, no better deal around. Unless you are a DG snob...these are sturdy, maneuverable, and have fun written all over them.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Works well, good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It catches Discs well and is nice and lightweight. It would take a little work to disassemble for portability, but I’m happy it’s an option. I’m a little doubtful of its long term durability, but for $63 I can’t complain. I’ll keep it covered in the winter or store it in the garage
customer_reviews.author: Mesa

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Broke within 3 months of use. Super disappointed. Daughter plays on the disc golf team and this was a great way to practice. Rusted at the base- photos shared.
customer_reviews.author: happy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: This was way better than I expected. Very sturdy and easy to assemble. Not too heavy and easy to move around but sturdy enough not to knock over. Very pleased with it, especially for $60.
customer_reviews.author: Jason_4_

customer_reviews.title: He loved it!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old grandson is hooked on disc golf and this basket was an absolute hit. He can practice his putting in the front and back yard and take it in trip to the park (or beach!) with his mom and dad.
customer_reviews.author: romaca

customer_reviews.title: Arrived missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived without a flag, ground stakes, and instructions. Assembly is pretty simple, so the missing instructions was not a big deal. However, I would like to have the flag and ground stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Heywood Jabuzof

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these so we could use it similar to corn hole or horse shoes. We have enjoyed the quality. Now if we could just learn how to throw a Frisbee accurately.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the frisbee player in your family
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this thing. It’s a great activity while being quarantined and the price was great and just as good as the more expensive baskets
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Rusty garbage
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. Basket rusted off within 3 months and the seller won't even respond to my email inquiries. Guess this is the performance they expect out of their product. I bought 9 of these things and they won't even answer me. Worst experience on Amazon BY FAR. Wish I could give it zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Affordable Golf Basket
customer_reviews.text: The product was just as described and arrived on time. We bought it to play as a family. It was very easy for my daughter and I to assemble, easy to move around, and very sturdy. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: CBTeacher

customer_reviews.title: Nice product. No regrets after buying it.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product and the price point is good. Our kids got us into disc golf...we enjoy it so much we setup a full 9 hole course in our backyard. Very satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The cheapest and best disc golf basket
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this basket. Sturdy, lightweight and easy to move around. And it was so much cheaper than the others. Cannot possibly be any better than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Tindell

customer_reviews.title: Great practice basket
customer_reviews.text: Pros: super easy to assemble, very lightweight, put a couple of bricks around the base and it’s not going anywhere. Cons: I’m still not as good as Paul McBeth.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Nice, lightweight basket.
customer_reviews.text: Great for a practice basket for my husband. Lightweight, easily moveable. He is working on his putting and felt it was sturdy enough to putt. He was very happy with it as a gift and felt that it was well made overall.
customer_reviews.author: CD Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great basket for the price!
customer_reviews.text: For the money it's decent but the top ring has 12 hooks to hang chains but there are only 11 chains.The company was very willing to correct this issue and replaced the chains free of charge. I would suggest this basket to anyone looking for a nice budget friendly practice basket.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy D. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: While it was a good price, the light-duty build just makes this thing too cheap. The chains are soo light that it barely catches. You have to "putt light" to get it to stay in the chains. I just don't think it was worth the lower price.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Backyard fun!
customer_reviews.text: For the price to quality this is excellent! I did add extra heavier duty chains so that it stops the discs better otherwise it just flies through them. I wish the surrounding basket itself was a bit shorter as the ones at discing courses are but in a way it should help your game by being more precise.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great for house
customer_reviews.text: The chains are little light but it just makes you play your game better. It has done a great job of staying up right in crazy winds, no added weight. I would buy it again and just might if we decide to make a small home course.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for backyard play.
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to put together and works great for backyard play. It hasn't had issues catching a disk, doesn't wobble or fall over, and feels well made. I would not leave it outside permanently, as it likely wouldn't hold up through the seasons, but for a practice basket, or for moving around for a backyard game, it is exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gift for Christmas Day! Sturdy and well made! Price was appropriate and shipping came with all parts . Very satisfied with this company and will use again. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Tennis

customer_reviews.title: Pro level product
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a pro level goal, but easy to set up and use. It is sturdy, but use a garden staple if you set up on a slope. Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Burris

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, priced well, made an excellent gift.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 27 year old son in law to practice disc golf. He removes the top to easily transport it in 2 pcs in the back of his SUV. It's sturdy and he brings it everywhere there's a field to practice in..he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We are casual players, new to the game. We decided to splurge to be able to practice here at home and it works great. It is lightweight enough to move around easily, breaks down fast without tools, Will fit into the back of the car if we want to transport it, and feels durable enough to last. Time will tell on that one...
customer_reviews.author: robert anderson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value. As described
customer_reviews.text: Shipped fast. Super easy to assemble with only four Alan head bolts. Looks nice. Great visibility. Chains are a bit light and you can still bounce off the pole, but still awesome for what you pay and it being very lightweight and portable! Only fixes I intend: Add chains and replace the Alan screws with wing nuts
customer_reviews.author: Austin Ford

customer_reviews.title: Great quality at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. I was a little wary due to the low price, but it arrived perfect, very stable and high quality. Looking forward to many hours of practice right at home. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Pandora

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginner and I bought this as a target to practice with. I'm pretty happy with it for the price. My only concern is that the pole does not fit into the connecting area correctly such that it appears the weight of the chains and upper part of the basket are on the "push lock" button(see picture above). This hasn't been an issue so far, though I've had this thing for a week. Will update if anything changes, but right now I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: JHastings

customer_reviews.title: great bargain basket
customer_reviews.text: been using this now in florida for about 6 months, I just keep it out in the lawn through all the rain and it has held up perfectly...a really great bargain basket...one most I made was to put a foam noodle around the center pole so as to make it less noisy for neighbors
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great product - good engineering.
customer_reviews.text: We have used these for a couple of weeks now and have had a blast. The whole family has enjoyed them. When they first arrived the fiberglass flags were broken. I sent an email to the seller and they quickly replaced them. Great customer service. Highly recommend these for any yard large enough to play frisbee golf.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: Summer fun
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy baskets. Easy to assemble and install on your property. Only downside is that the chains unhook easy when transporting
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: Good for pandemic.
customer_reviews.text: It's quite very convenient to have it with us, cause you can take it anywhere including to the beach. And when you have nothing else to do, the assembly is easy and can't find a near by disc golf park you can always bring the basket with you.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Towner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition for a disc golfer
customer_reviews.text: My husband enjoyed receiving this as a gift, especially with 2020 and closing of parks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Good paint, easy assembly, our box did not come with screws, and the main pole had 2 holes not lined up correctly. Had to go buy screws, and manually drill holes for them. Everything else is good.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Broussard

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you really want it
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you really want this item before you buy it. I bought it for my sister's soon to be ex & when I found out they're getting a divorce I sent it back & they charged me a huge restocking fee. People these days are so selfish.
customer_reviews.author: Tony y Letisia

customer_reviews.title: Easy breakdown with quality materials
customer_reviews.text: This disc gold basket is perfect for the pro to practice. Or just for an amatuer to learn and have fun. It breaks down incredibly easy. The materials are all quality made and welded. Ive had a great time using this basket. I'm very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: troy rinier

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected at this price point! - Well made. Heavier duty metal than I expected. Satisfying "kachink" when you go in the basket.
customer_reviews.author: Phoink

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my husband & he was super excited to set it up. He loves the fact that he doesn't have to permanently put it in the ground & it remains sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: If you want a sturdy mid level quality, this is a good option
customer_reviews.text: While I grab this from the base it can be a bit challenging to move around a large yard/park. Easy to put together, it does feel cheap but a durable cheap. Going into my second year of owning it and I couldn’t be more happy with it
customer_reviews.author: William Henson

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to put together, around 5-10 minutes was all it took. Only used it a couple of times so far but it’s worked very well so far. Wish it had 24 instead of 12 chains but for the cost I can’t complain. Overall I’d recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy J

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble. Catches disks
customer_reviews.text: Has been good so far. Easy to assemble. Not much else I can day.
customer_reviews.author: John and Rachel Teasley

customer_reviews.title: Disc Golf Practice at Home
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gift for grandson's birthday. Easy to assemble. No need to attach to ground.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So easy to put together that my two young kids did ...
customer_reviews.text: So easy to put together that my two young kids did it all by themselves! We've had such a wonderful time playing in our backyard! Great quality!
customer_reviews.author: B. Suzanne Murray

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Great item. Arrived on time and easy to assemble. Fun to play with. So far No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ming

customer_reviews.title: Great basket, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great practice basket. It’s very light, very easy to put together and take apart for travel. Chains catch OKAY, which just makes you have to hit them more dead center. Only problem I have is that my base is slightly uneven so it doesn’t really stand perfectly straight.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cage. Highly recommend! Super sturdy and very portable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Good, but doesn’t have double strands of chain
customer_reviews.text: Does not have a double chain as described, but rather a single layer with some horizontal strands attached to the vertical strands. However, it’s a nice basket. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and nicely packed
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty impressed with the two of these I got. The color looks good, the chains catch well, the height is fine. I would probably buy again. I'd give five stars but I have a feeling the colors won't last the test of time because it was scratching off during assembly, which isn't important, but it's there.
customer_reviews.author: Barton

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the price. I wasn’t looking to spend $125+ on a basket having made my own years ago, so I gave this one a try based on reviews. Chains were heavier than expected. Perfect for backyard play or creating your own personal course. I appreciate the value of this basket because I’m always looking for the best bang for my buck. Obviously not perfect, but a perfectly acceptable basket.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Bakewell

customer_reviews.title: Great item and customer service
customer_reviews.text: Great basket, dimensions are perfect, it is sturdy, and it reliably catches discs. I set it up in 10 minutes. My package came without the screws so I contacted the seller and they shipped a replacement promptly. It can stand on its own without the screws but it is hard to carry around that way.
customer_reviews.author: David Swigon

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and decent quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: This Yaheetech basket is doing good so far for practice. I wish it had a better chain design though.
customer_reviews.author: Outbackwack

customer_reviews.title: Great price for fun
customer_reviews.text: I got this practice basket for my boyfriend’s birthday and it is now the number one thing our backyard is used for. We have putting competitions and move the basket around the yard quite a bit. It is sturdy, even on semi unlevel ground. It was very easy to put together, as I had it together in 15 minutes. We are really enjoying it and the price couldn’t be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best one I've tried, making a full 18 hole course
customer_reviews.text: Great basket, I've ordered several now, and will come back for all 18 for the course. Nicely built and even in my high winds these stay upright in the ground. Seller is great and fast reply when questions are submitted. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money..very good quality and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this.. great quality...sturdy... great product..best one with a lower cost
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Breeden

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home and camping use
customer_reviews.text: My husband and two stepsons enjoys this basket every evening that it’s warm and not raining.
customer_reviews.author: aleshia radcliffe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome basket, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic basket!! Can move it easily and it's nice and sturdy, so we don't have to worry about it falling over at any point. The chains are great and catch the disks easily. Easy to set up, definitely worth the 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: momof3

customer_reviews.title: Nice big frisbee goal for home use.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, nice large frisbee golf goals. The screws are very small and easily stripped during tightening, thus the 4 stars. Overall, happy with product. Very clunky to move around but manageable. Probably will change out the screws.
customer_reviews.author: Alaina E.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves it. We bring it with us to parks, or he uses it in the back yard.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Arend

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It stops the discs in the chains perfectly. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Janine anbinder

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cage as a birthday gift for a friend and he loves it. The quality is great and it was easy to build. Great for bbqs at the park and practice putting.
customer_reviews.author: JDM NERDS

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a solid basket
customer_reviews.text: Awesome value for this basket. Put it together in about 10 minutes, everything fit together perfectly. It feels pretty solid, but still easy to carry around. I threw discs at it for about an hour and never saw it wobble at all. The only negative is that the chains are pretty light. It missed catching a few that would have been caught with some of the heavy duty baskets. Overall, definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Spruit

customer_reviews.title: Perfect practice net unbeatable price.
customer_reviews.text: Can’t believe how little I paid for this. It exceeded my expectations. Perfect practice net. Catches discs great, easy to move or put away, finish looks great. All my holes aligned perfectly unlike some Other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Sei 5

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Withstands anise from weather and kids! Great quality, easy assembly. We ordered 3, and even my 9 year old put one together by himself.
customer_reviews.author: Kate C.

product_meta.title: YAHEETECH Disc Golf Basket Portable Metal Disc Golf Target Flying Disc Golf Practice Basket Indoor & Outdoor
feature_bullets: Good durability: Our disc golf basket is constructed of powder-coated metal frame and galvanized chains. The excellent rust and weather resistance gives this flying disc basket the ability to withstand the elements, making it an ideal disc sports accessory for outdoors.

Stable & Robust: This solid basket contains 12 strands of heavy-duty chain for better catching; welded joints and big base frame strengthen the stability of this basket; comes with 3 ground stakes for double stability, no need to worry about tipping over by the hit from the disc or wind.
Portable & Easy-to-store: Built in a lightweight and collapsible structure, convenient to move and transport; can be simply disassembled into a flat and compact size when not in use.

Thoughtful details: Featuring a 64 cm / 25.2’’ basket for catching and storing the disc; comes with an eye-catching flag on top to help improve the accuracy of your throw; 3 ground anchors are included for double security.

Simple assembly: To ensure quick setup and disassembly, this flying disc basket only contains 6 pieces (base, base rod, basket, top rod, chain belt, and top ring), which only takes you a few minutes to set up under the detailed instructions.
